qas.question: What is considered to be neglected in American history?

answers.text: Interracial relations between Indigenous Americans and African Americans

qas.question: When is it recorded that Africans and natives interacted earliest?
Where did Africans escape and mate with naitves?
Where did Ayllon lay down a Spanish colony?

answers.text: near the mouth of the Pee Dee River

qas.question: How many slaves were at San Miguel de Gualdape at its inception?

plausible_answers.text: Interracial relations between Indigenous Americans and African Americans

qas.question: What is a part of American history that has been paid a lot of attention?
What is the latest record of African and Indigenous American relations in the Americas?
Where were the last Black Indians born?
When was the latest year that African slaves were absorbed into Indigenous Americans?
How many free Africans lived in San Miguel de Gualdape?

context: <a0_0><b5_0>Interracial relations between Indigenous Americans and African Americans<b5_0/><a0_0/> is a part of American history that has been neglected. The earliest record of African and Indigenous American relations in the Americas occurred in <a1_0><b6_0>April 1502<b6_0/><a1_0/>, when the first Africans kidnapped were brought to Hispaniola to serve as slaves. Some escaped, and somewhere inland on <a2_0><b7_0>Santo Domingo<b7_0/><a2_0/>, the first Black Indians were born. In addition, an example of African slaves' escaping from European colonists and being absorbed by Indigenous Americans occurred as far back as <b8_0>1526<b8_0/>. In June of that year, Lucas Vasquez de Ayllon established a Spanish colony <a3_0>near the mouth of the Pee Dee River<a3_0/> in what is now eastern South Carolina. The Spanish settlement was named San Miguel de Gualdape. Amongst the settlement were <a4_0><b9_0>100<b9_0/> enslaved Africans<a4_0/>. In 1526, the first African slaves fled the colony and took refuge with local Indigenous Americans.
